changes.title: Multiple inheritance for packets
changes.description:
Packets can extend multiple other packets and many levels deep.
Attributes and files are inherited.
Extend the Terraform runner packet and inherit the plan and apply actions, for example. See [Packet](https://infraxys.io/concepts/resource-types/packet/) for more information.

changes.title: Confirmers; require approval/confirmation to apply a plan.
changes.description: Confirmers are non-default ways to require some kind of confirmation before a Terraform plan can be applied. The SES-email confirmer, for example, sends an email to one or more email-address contain the Terraform plan for review and a button to directly apply the plan.

changes.title: New Python class generator
changes.description:
Attribute 'Class' is added to the packet-view.
A Python class under the module-directory 'generated' will be created automatically.
This class contains variables for the attributes and details about the packet.
Use this, for example, to easily invoke the Infraxys REST-API to retrieve and create instances.

changes.title: 5 cache levels
changes.description:
Cache binaries, Terraform plans and provisioners, data, ... and re-use it in actions of the same instance, container, environment or project.
A global cache is also available which is readable by any action, but can only be written to from actions in environments that are linked directly under the root-project.
See [Cache concept](https://infraxys.io/topics/caching/) for more details.

title: Infraxys changelog
description: This page contains important changes done to Infraxys and its supported modules.
